oai_dc:dc.dc:title: PARAMETRIC WAVE-BREAKING ON STEEP REEFS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Su, Shih-Feng
Sheremet, Alex
Smith, Jane McKee
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: nonlinear waves
wave breaking
coral reef
wave modeling
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A numerical model based on a nonlinear mild-slope equation, and modified to account for wave dissipation due to breaking is applied to investigate the transformation of the wave spectrum over a fringing reef. The three parameters (Î³, B, F) of the breaking model are calibrated for the best fit between the spectral shapes observed and modeled using an inverse modeling approach. The relationship between optimal values for Î³ and B derived from numerical simulations and other parameters characterizing wave and slope conditions (e.g., deep-water wave steepness, wave dispersivity, nonlinearity parameter) are investigated with the goal of formulating guidelines for the selection of adequate values. The results of this study disagree significantly with previously-proposed empirical relations between Î³ and the deep-water wave steepness, but show good agreement with empirical relations relating Î³ to other parameters. The breaking intensity parameter B shows a largely linear dependency on the nonlinearity parameter.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 32 (2010): Proceedings of 32nd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Shanghai, China, 2010.; waves.16
